title: Tangent Line Equation
text: The tangent line to f(x) at a is the line passing through the point (a,f(a)) having slope $$\lim_{h\to0} \frac{f{\left(a+h\right)}-f{\left(a\right)}}{h}$$.
speech: The tangent line to f(x) at a is the line passing through the point (a,f(a)) having slope  the limit as h approaches 0, of fraction, f of, parentheses a plus h,  minus f of a, over h,  .
pacedSpeech: The tangent line to f(x) at a is the line passing through the point (a,f(a)) having slope   the limit as h approaches 0, of fraction, f of,  a plus h,  minus f of a, over h,

title: Plugging In
text: As $$a=2$$ in this equation, plug $$-4$$ into every a.
speech: As , a is equal to, 2  in this equation, plug  negative 4  into every a.

title: Simplify
speech: Simplify the resulting equation:  fraction, fraction, 2 over, h minus 4 plus 3,  minus, fraction, 2 over, 3 minus 4,  over h,
pacedSpeech: Simplify the resulting equation:   fraction, fraction, 2 over, h minus 4 plus 3,  minus, fraction, 2 over, 3 minus 4,  over h,
